intro: Crotalaria leptocarpa subsp. contracta, commonly known as the narrowleaf crotalaria, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, curved pods that split open when mature, releasing small, kidney-shaped seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some regions for forage or as a green manure.
